page.title: 01LANDSCAPE : AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area is situated in the Peak Park, within 20 minutes drive by car from Chesterfield and Sheffield in the east, and immediately north of the Chatsworth Estate.Most of the land, which rises from the River Derwent at 310m to the gritstone edges, is pasture land whilst moorland dominates most of the highland up to 350m. Some highland is successfully cultivated. The villages began to grow in the 1960's when they attracted people from professions who worked in Sheffield. New families now replace those whose companies require them to move on. Most of the following information has been obtained from the questionnaires answered by children attending both primary schools and their parents, and therefore represents the lives of families.
